message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: You can pass the boardSize parameter to the JavaScript or HTML by including it as a query parameter in the URL when redirecting from the servlet to the BoardGame.html page. Here's an example:

In your GameSettingsServlet.java, after creating the Engine object, you can redirect to the BoardGame.html page with the boardSize parameter included in the URL:

response.sendRedirect("BoardGame.html?boardSize=" + boardSize);

Then, in your BoardGame.html, you can retrieve the boardSize parameter using JavaScript:

var boardSize = parseInt(getParameterByName("boardSize"));

function getParameterByName(name) {
    name = name.replace(/[\[\]]/g, "\\$&");
    var regex = new RegExp("[?&]" + name + "(=([^&#]*)|&|#|$)"),
        results = regex.exec(window.location.href);
    if (!results) return null;
    if (!results[2]) return '';
    return decodeURIComponent(results[2].replace(/\+/g, " "));
}

Now, you can use the boardSize variable in your JavaScript code to create the board with the appropriate number of rows and columns.

Note: The getParameterByName function is a helper function to retrieve query parameters from the URL. You can include it in your BoardGame.html file.
